column1: Other common causes of urination at night include: - Infection of the bladder or urinary tract - Drinking a lot of alcohol, caffeine, or other fluids before bedtime - Enlarged prostate gland (BPH) - Pregnancy Other conditions that can lead to the problem include: - Chronic kidney failure - Diabetes - Drinking excessive amount of water - Heart failure - High blood calcium level - Certain medicines, including water pills (diuretics) - Diabetes insipidus Waking often during the night to urinate can also be linked to obstructive sleep apnea and other sleeping disorders.

Tests that may be performed include: - Blood sugar (glucose) - Blood urea nitrogen - Fluid deprivation - Osmolality, blood - Serum creatinine or creatinine clearance - Serum electrolytes - Urinalysis - Urine concentration - Urine culture - You may be asking to keep track of how much liquid you take in and how much you void at a time (voiding diary) Treatment depends on the cause.
